subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: Rj

--0-2080146048-1244575948=:50167
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


I have never heard of the aether and the cosmic background radiation being=
 called the same thing.=C2=A0 In discussing aether, we were speaking of the=
 medium through which EM travels.=C2=A0 Cosmic Background Radiation is EM i=
tself, not the aether medium.=C2=A0 For example, a large part of this radia=
tion is microwave frequencies.=C2=A0 Microwave frequencies are not the aeth=
er.=C2=A0 An old theory was that it traveled through the aether.=C2=A0 But =
mainline science does not put much credence in this theory anymore.

If you=
 have a link where you see the cosmic background radiation and the aether b=
eing called the same thing, I=E2=80=99d be happy to look at it.=C2=A0 

I h=
ave never heard of the =E2=80=9Cprimordial energy gradient=E2=80=9D. Again,=
 if you have a link to a definition of this term, please provide.

The jury=
 is still out on 1) If aether is necessary for EM propagation, and 2) if ZP=
E is analogous to it.=C2=A0 From what I read, mainline science does not cur=
rently accept the concept of Aether, and does not equate ZPE to it.=C2=A0 T=
here are some efforts to redefine what aether is (which has happened severa=
l times over at least the last 100 years).=C2=A0 It could finally land on a=
 definition that is generally accepted.=C2=A0 But so far, it=E2=80=99s not =
quite there.

But again, if you have links supporting your other statements=
 (the aether is cosmic background radiation, or what a =E2=80=9Cprimordial =
energy gradient=E2=80=9D is), please post.=C2=A0 Thanks.


--- On Tue, 6/9/=
09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@...> wrote:

From: Frank Ratka <warrior=
18eii@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.c=
om
Date: Tuesday, June 9, 2009, 6:05 AM











    
            
      =
      


      
      The name aether is sometimes still used but now it is=
 called cosmic background radiation, primordial energy gradient=C2=A0or mor=
e recently the zero-point field. The only way it can be proven to exist is =
in reference to acceleration. The zero-point field is theories to penetrate=
 all things accept for a charged medium, which instead gives you a distorti=
on field in the zero-point field we call a magnetic field. The zero-point f=
ield is the "canvas" that the universe and all matter is painted on. It is =
the only thing that still oscillates at absolute zero when all other system=
s cease to move. This oscillation is called a funny word called "zitterbewe=
gung" motion.
=C2=A0
Of course all this is theorized but it seems to fit th=
e math and is being used by many physicists in research today in the field =
of quantum electrodynamics. Some of the researchers studying this are Dr. H=
arold Puthoff, Dr. Michael Ibison, Dr. Bernard Haisch and many others who a=
lso have differing opinion on howit works but not whether it exists or not.=
 This seems to have been deemed, accepted theory.
=C2=A0
Frank R.

--- On M=
on, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com=
>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monda=
y, June 8, 2009, 4:17 PM








I'm not sure what you mean by "Aether".=C2=
=A0 EM can propagate through a vacuum: it needs no medium like your other e=
xamples.=C2=A0 It, in a sense, creates its own medium as electric and magne=
tic forces interact with each other, causing a wave in that interaction tha=
t is moving outward from the source.=C2=A0 Early physics theories of someth=
ing called the aether have, as far as I can tell, been abandoned (it seems =
Einstein had a lot to do with that).












From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zac=
k@gmail. com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Monday, June 8, 2009 3:43:=
47 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas




You can create a wave in anythin=
g. You can create a wave in a rope by having a person hold each end and the=
n having one person wiggle the rope. You can create a wave in a lake by dro=
pping a rock into it. The thing that carries the wave is the propagating me=
dium. In these examples it's the rope and water respectively.
=C2=A0
In the=
 case of sound, the propagating medium is the air. It is a longitudinal pre=
ssure wave. It cannot be picked up on a receiver that is capable of receivi=
ng the same frequencies as electromagnetic waves.
=C2=A0
There are receiver=
s and antennas that can pick up electromagnetic waves of the same frequenci=
es as sound waves. But in this case, the propagating medium is the aether. =
They are transverse electromagnetic waves and you can't hear them.

The ele=
ctromagnetic spectrum extends from sub-audible frequencies all the way up t=
o the frequencies of X-rays and cosmic rays. Different methods exist to det=
ect or receive different parts of this spectrum. I'm involved in a ULF grou=
p that specializes in receiving electromagnetic waves of the Schumann reson=
ances which are around 6 Hz, plus or minus.
=C2=A0
Zack
=C2=A0

=C2=A0
On M=
on, Jun 8, 2009 at 2:38 PM, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:


=











It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ....."
=C2=A0
A mistake t=
hat a lot of people make is thinking that there are two different types of =
energy at work when it comes to sound waves and electromagnetic waves. The =
only thing that seperates them is frequency and power. Radio waves are radi=
o waves because they occupy a certain block of the electromagnietic spectru=
m. Sound waves exist on that same spectrum just farther down with much long=
er waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can penetrate almost anything becau=
se of their wavelengths. The shorter the wavelength the more ways we can sh=
ield against them.
=C2=A0
Think of microwaves. These are also a type of rad=
io and telemetry transmitting wave but the waves also have a physical effec=
t on our environment by causing molecules to speed up, which creates heat. =
A little lower than this is IR or infrared it too can cause physical object=
s to heat up but usually it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All p=
hysical things give off IR light. Its a way the total system conserves ener=
gy by spontaneously emitting IR radiation.
=C2=A0
Frank R. 


--- On Mon, 6=
/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:



F=
rom: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
Subject: Re: =
[EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments] 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Mo=
nday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM





Here is some food for thought. I am curren=
tly reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.
=C2=A0
It was me an=
d another girl teammate=C2=A0present in the room. I picked up a 3rd female =
voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with me. We were standing r=
ight next to another digital video recorder that I leave beside my night vi=
sion camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have asked the=
 girl that was with me to check her recording to see if she picked it up.
=
=C2=A0
I have long felt the true EVP does not come from sound waves in the =
environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow E=
VP's are appearing directly on the recordings.
=C2=A0
This instance with th=
e recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder should have picked=
 that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.
=C2=A0
I am attac=
hing the clip of this 3rd voice. The=C2=A0file that is named=C2=A0"01-02-17=
 Clip" is the full clip.=C2=A0You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and t=
hen another comes in right after that. I think I know what it says.
=C2=A0
=
Again, I was live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear this until pl=
ayback. It isn't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one's from th=
e last investigation.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0


----- Original Message ----- 
From: F=
rank Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 

Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09=
 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas









I have a running theory that =
EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they wan=
t it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ult=
rasonic waves that differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtr=
act them together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For exam=
ple, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan i=
n a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a int=
ermediate difference=C2=A0frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing rang=
e (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic equipment g=
enerates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I alw=
ays felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of the recorder.
=C2=
=A0
We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radio with superhetero=
dyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars an=
d a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.
=
=C2=A0

Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com> wro=
te:



From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New i=
deas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM





=

Fascinating! I've had this idea that the EVP are often=C2=A0not recorded b=
y the microphone but somehow make their way in at the actual=C2=A0point whe=
re the storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) or digital.=C2=A0

So m=
uch we don't know ...
=C2=A0
Zack

=C2=A0

On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, =
April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:










I=
 monitor my audio live. The funny thing is that even so, those last EVP's I=
 captured I did not hear either in the environment, or on my recording as i=
t happened. I only heard them upon playback.
=C2=A0



----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
From: Zack Widup 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 




Sent: Monda=
y, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas





I am curiou=
s if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EV=
P in real time.
=C2=A0
I=C2=A0took part in=C2=A0an investigation of Ashmore=
 Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras set =
up in the three halls of the building. The video for all=C2=A0was being mon=
itored and recorded=C2=A0at a central location. Alas, we did not have micro=
phones at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wonder what =
we might have heard if we did?
=C2=A0
Zack

=C2=A0

et's just agree to end this discussion about her...

omething on a lighter note? Anyone have any new ideas about either evp or I=
TC? 
Al

<div>A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking =
that there are two different types of energy at work when it comes to sound=
 waves and electromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is fre=
quency and power. Radio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certain=
 block of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spe=
ctrum just farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic wav=
es can penetrate almost anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter =
the wavelength the more ways we can shield against them.</div>
<div> <=

<div>Think of microwaves. These are also a type of radio and telemetr=
y transmitting wave but the waves also have a physical effect on our enviro=
nment by causing molecules to speed up, which creates heat. A little lower =
than this is IR or infrared it too can cause physical objects to heat up bu=
t usually it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All physical things =
give off IR light. Its a way the total system conserves energy by spontaneo=
usly emitting IR radiation.</div>

<div class=3D"im">
<div>I have a running theory that EVP is c=
arried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to =
manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic =
waves that differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them=
 together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if =
a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room=
 creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediat=
e difference frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz =
to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates=
 ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt=
 that EVP were generated within a few inches of the recorder.</div>
<div>&n=
bsp;</div>
<div>We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radio with=
 superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some passi=
ve sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Jose=
ph Pompeii.</div>
<div> </div></div>
<div class=3D"im">
<div>Frank R.<=

<div>Fascinating! I've had this idea that the EVP are of=
ten not recorded by the microphone but somehow make their way in at th=
e actual point where the storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) =
or digital. <br></div>
<div>So much we don't know ...</div>

v>
<div>I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has=
 ever gotten any EVP in real time.</div>
<div> </div>
<div>I took=
 part in an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Satu=
rday night. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls of the build=
ing. The video for all was being monitored and recorded at a cent=
ral location. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera sites conecte=
d to the central location. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?</di=
v>
<div> </div>
<div>Zack</div>
